subject: Medicine
title: Universal Healthcare Debate
description: A quick, practical guide to Universal Healthcare Debate.

hook.text: Americans pay more per person for healthcare than any nation on Earth‚Äîand millions still can't afford to see a doctor.

buildup.text: Universal healthcare provides coverage to all citizens, funded through taxes or social insurance systems.

discovery.text: Countries with universal systems often achieve better health outcomes at lower cost per person.

twist.text: Opponents argue that universal healthcare reduces innovation and creates long wait times for procedures.

climax.text: The ethical question is simple: is healthcare a right or a privilege? The answer defines the system.

punchline.text: The answer to that question builds the system.

quiz.question: What is the fundamental ethical question about healthcare access?
options: Whether healthcare is a right or a privilege
Which country has the most hospitals per capita
Whether doctors should earn higher salaries
